employee_id.notes: Direct mapping - available in response schema

absence_type_external_id.notes: Conversion: map to the referenced timeOff plan id

status.notes: Conversion: available in response but read-only (e.g., 'Successfully Completed', 'Denied', 'Terminated')

start_date.notes: Direct mapping - single date field for time off entry

end_date.notes: Logical: Workday uses single date entries; end_date same as start_date for single-day entries

start_half_day.notes: Unmappable: Workday API doesn't support half-day logic in timeOffEntries

end_half_day.notes: Unmappable: Workday API doesn't support half-day logic in timeOffEntries

amount.notes: Conversion: integer units field for time off amount

unit.notes: Direct mapping - unitOfTime field specifies the unit

employee_note.notes: Conversion: descriptor field can be used for employee notes/description

start_half_day.reason: Workday API doesn't support half-day logic in timeOffEntries schema
start_half_day.api_limitation: Single date field only, no time component or half-day indicators

end_half_day.reason: Workday API doesn't support half-day logic in timeOffEntries schema
end_half_day.api_limitation: Single date field only, no time component or half-day indicators

api_analysis_notes.critical_limitation: Workday Common API v1 is READ-ONLY for time off entries - no POST methods available for creating new entries
api_analysis_notes.date_logic: Single date field per entry - no start/end date range support
api_analysis_notes.half_day_logic: Not supported - single date entries only

processing_context: Workday Common API v1 - READ-ONLY time off entries, single date per entry
